ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Get experience in the IRB process, interviewing subjects, diving into a literature, applying for funding, and developing a research plan.

Learned more about research and was given the opportunity to develop a structure to guide my work on my thesis. Through both peer work and insights from the professors and TFs, I was able to fine-tune my ideas and get set to really dive into data analysis and writing for second semester.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Slightly more structured assignments for each week with hem being tailored towards the type of data or research questions each student is asking.
I liked the semi-regular meetings with the other majors, as I was nice to rant about problems to people who might have gone through similar things.
While a great sign of the department's growth, I think there was much to gain from the smaller iterations of the major.

I think that the research design document is a useful exercise for people who are starting to bring their thesis together. I wonder if there might be a better way to give students who are further on their thesis an opportunity to make the documents more useful and use more time to put in hard hours in data analysis and collection. I liked peer work and feedback from the TFs. I'm not sure if the texts at the beginning helped that much but I assume that it's a requirement for the course. Overall, I was glad that sessions were structured in such a way that it didn't feel like we were in class just to be in class.
Great course, helpful and enthusiastic TFs and professor, makes the intensive thesis digestible and builds a great community of soc majors.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Great to take this class to work with other students. Papachristos makes it very enjoyable and engaging.
I mean, if you want to graduate the major having done something really worthwhile.

If you're reading the reviews you're likely a SOCY major thinking about whether or not you want to write a thesis, so my advice is DO IT. Yes, it's a lot of work but it's worth it. Plus, hanging with Prof. Papachristos every week is fun and he's great to work with.
